conclusion: Analyze the process step by step to determine the work done by the gas from state B to state C.

State A: Volume \( V_A = V_0 \), Pressure \( P_A = P_0 \), Temperature \( T_A = T_0 \); State B: Volume \( V_B = V_0 \), Pressure \( P_B = 0.6P_0 \); State C: Volume \( V_C = 0.5V_0 \), Pressure \( P_C = 0.6P_0 \).
The process from state B to state C is an isobaric process (constant pressure).
For an isobaric process, the work done \( W \) by the gas is given by \( W = P \Delta V \).
Calculate the change in volume: \( \Delta V = V_C - V_B = 0.5V_0 - V_0 = -0.5V_0 \).
Calculate the work done: \( W = P_C \Delta V = 0.6P_0 \times (-0.5V_0) = -0.3P_0 V_0 \).
The negative sign indicates that work is done on the gas (work is done by the surroundings on the gas).
The work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C is \(-0.3P_0 V_0\).
